content:
• Friday, February 23, 2018
  • GHC

    Graham Holdings revenue grows despite education slowdown

    • Graham Holdings (NYSE:GHC) posted Q4 earnings in which solid gains in its other-businesses division (which includes healthcare, manufacturing, marketing and media) more than made up for a drop-off in its mainline education group.
    • Net income swelled to $214.2M for the quarter from a prior-year $36.9M thanks to a significant benefit logged from tax reform. Excluding a number of items for comparability (including education restructuring, goodwill impairment, forex gains, and tax benefits, among others), net income for Q4 was $43.2M vs. a previous $54.4M.
    • Revenue grew 7% overall; operating results declined at the education and TV broadcasting units.
    • Revenue by division: Education, $380.6M (down 3%); Television Broadcasting, $111M (up 2%); Other businesses, $184.3M (up 42%).
    • Shares are flat in postmarket action; they gained 2.8% during the regular session.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 PM
  • X

    U.S. Steel, AK Steel jump on report that Trump wants 24% steel tariff

    • Steel and aluminum names are higher after-hours as Pres. Trump reportedly has told confidants that he wants to impose the harshest possible tariffs on imports: X +5.2%, AKS +4.9%, CENX +3.7%, STLD +1.4%, MT +1.1%, AA +1%, NUE +0.3%, KALU +0.3%.
    • Trump is said to want to a 24% global tariff on steel imports, the most severe of three options presented to him by the Commerce Department in a report last month, and is considering as much as a 10% duty on all aluminum entering the U.S., which would be higher than the recommendations.
    • White House officials say the process is ongoing.
    • ETFs: SLX, JJU-OLD, FOIL
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM | 73 Comments

  • IRIX

    IRIDEX lowers Q4 guidance after recall of laser accessory

    • Thinly traded nano cap IRIDEX (NASDAQ:IRIX) has lowered its guidance for Q4 2017 to $10.2M - 10.3M from $11.0M - 11.1M due to a voluntary recall of its TruFocus LIO Premier, a head-mounted indirect ophthalmoscope used to view and perform procedures on the eye with one of its lasers.
    • The company decided to recall the product after receiving three reports that patients experienced permanent eye damage, including focal cataracts and iris burns, in treatments where the TruFocus LIO Premier was used. It says there are 104 of the devices at customer sites worldwide.
    • It plans to release Q4 and 2017 results on Tuesday, March 8, after the close.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 5 Comments
  • TDS

    Telephone & Data Systems +11% with help of wireless business

    • Telephone & Data Systems (NYSE:TDS) is up 10.7% after its Q4 beat where it supplemented wireless gains with growing margins in wireline and cable.
    • As usual, results are heavily affected by those at U.S. Cellular (USM +11.3%), of which TDS holds a heavy majority, and which beat expectations on top and bottom lines and added postpaid and prepaid subscribers.
    • Wireline residential connections declined overall to 567,700 from a year-ago 585,400 and last quarter's 575,300. IPTV showed the only growth there (to 48,600 connections from 45,300); broadband shrunk slightly, to 228,600 from 229,500, and voice sank to 290,600 from 310,600.
    • Commercial wireline connections fell as well, to 310,100 from last year's 329,700 and last quarter's 315,300. Declines were across the board there: Voice down to 143,000 from 157,400; Broadband down to 20,600 from 21,400; and managedIP down t5o 146,500 from 150,900.
    • Cable connections, meanwhile, rose to 315,100 from 292,400, with broadband growing to 153,300 from 133,700; video up to 101,800 from 99,000; and voice up to 60,100 from 59,600.
    • For 2018, it's guiding to revenues of $5.015B-$5.265B, EBITDA of $1.075B-$1.255B and capex of $795M-$845M.
    • Earnings call transcript
    • Earnings call slides
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • NRG

    NRG Energy started at Buy, Vistra Energy at Neutral by UBS

    • NRG Energy (NRG +4.6%) is initiated with a Buy rating and a $33 price target at UBS, which believes the stock will climb as announced asset sales close and plans for return of capital are revealed at the company's March 27 analyst day.
    • NRG has indicated it will seek projects averaging 13.75% unlevered pre-tax returns or return capital to shareholders, and UBS thinks the market would prefer share buybacks and is the message NRG likely will deliver, given the high bar set for investment returns.
    • UBS says incremental deleveraging likely is unnecessary, with pro forma net debt-to-EBITDA at 2.8x at year-end 2018 and an ongoing free cash flow yield of 13%; the firm also expects an update on progress toward cost-cuts and margin enhancements goals at the analyst day meeting.
    • UBS also initiates Vistra Energy (VST +1.7%) but with a Neutral rating and $21 target, seeing shares as fairly valued even with closing of the Dynegy deal, as the company is more exposed longer term to volatility in the power markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • USM

    U.S. Cellular +11% after Q4 beat, continued subscriber growth

    • U.S. Cellular (NYSE:USM) is up 11.2% after its Q4 earnings beat expectations with revenue growth driven by equipment sales.
    • The company swung to a gain from a year-ago loss even excluding tax adjustments from new legislation; net income as reported was $273M (including a benefit of $269M), vs. a year-ago loss of $6M.
    • Postpaid subs showed a net gain of 5,000, bringing its total to 4.518M; Prepaid service added a net 4,000 to land at 519,000.
    • Revenue breakout: Service, $755M (up 0.4%); Equipment sales, $274M (up 8%).
    • Postpaid ARPU dropped Y/Y to $44.12 from $45.19, but was up from last quarter's $43.41. Churn rate fell to 1.27% from last year's 1.41% but was up slightly from last quarter's 1.16%.
    • Prepaid ARPU declined on a Y/Y and sequential basis, at $32.42 down from last year's $33.25 and last quarter's $33.12.
    • For 2018, it's guiding to revenues of $3.85B-$4.05B, adjusted EBITDA of $765M-$915M and capex of $500M-$550M.
    • Earnings call slides
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • INT

    World Fuel Services sinks to 52-week low amid declining bunker sales

    • World Fuel Services (INT -14.6%) plunges as much as 18% to a 52-week low after reporting a sharp Q4 earnings miss, as gross profit in the company's marine segment fell 16% Y/Y to $126M.
    • INT says it sold 26.5M metric tons of bunkers in 2017, a 15.6% drop from 31.4M metric tons sold the previous year and following reduced quarterly volumes throughout the year.
    • INT says it has seen "growing weakness" in maritime markets over the last year, along with a further decline in demand for price risk management products.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • ALB

    Albemarle a Buy at Argus on strong lithium demand

    • Albemarle (ALB +4.1%) is initiated with a Buy rating and a $148 price target at Argus Research, which expects the company to benefit from the accelerating production of electric vehicle batteries.
    • Argus estimates sales of lithium-ion batteries will grow 17% on average during 2017-25, reaching $93B by the end of 2025.
    • Although ALB has three business segments each accounting for about one-third of revenue, Argus expects the lithium business to generate an increasing percentage of sales.
    • The firm says ALB trades at a discounted valuation to its peer group even though the company is poised to grow earnings by 17% over the next five years vs. 10.9% for peers.
    • Earlier: Albemarle declares $0.335 dividend (Feb. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 24 Comments
  • ADMP

    Adamis Pharma closing in on Symjepi commercialization partner; shares ahead 34%

    • Adamis Pharmaceuticals (ADMP +34.3%) is up on almost a 7x surge in volume on the heels of its announcement that it is in the latter stages of discussions with two potential commercialization partners for emergency allergy med Symjepi (epinephrine).
    • Previously: FDA OKs Adamis Pharma's epinephrine auto-injector; shares up 34%; Mylan down 3% (June 15, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM | 12 Comments

  • Stocks shoot higher

    • A modestly up day has turned into a sizable rally in the past few minutes, with the Nasdaq now higher by 1.5% and the S&P 500 1.3%.
    • There's no particular news that hit, but maybe helping is a big rally in the roughed-up fixed-income sector. The 10-year Treasury yield is lower by 5 basis points to 2.87%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM | 8 Comments

  • TAHO

    Tahoe Resources' disappointing Q4 reflects Escobal mine reopening delays

    • Tahoe Resources (TAHO -2.5%) tumbles after reporting a larger than expected Q4 loss and a 38% Y/Y revenue decline due to the ongoing shutdown of its flagship Escobal silver mine in Guatemala.
    • Despite the Escobal mine suspension, Tahoe says it achieved record gold production of 445.9K oz. in 2017, at the high end of its guidance range of 400K-450K oz., which was revised upward in September.
    • Full-year silver production totaled just 9.9M oz., reflecting the impact of the halt at Escobal, which has been shut since last July after an order from Guatemala’s Supreme Court following an appeal from the CALAS human rights organization.
    • While the company says it expects a ruling in favor of reinstating the Escobal mining license, Tahoe says it will not provide guidance or long-term outlook for silver production or costs until steady operations at Escobal resume.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 16 Comments
  • TI

    Telecom Italia approves bid for Persidera stake, with new offer queuing up

    • Telecom Italia's (TI +2.1%) board has voted in favor of a sole bid for its stake in the Persidera broadcasting unit, though a second bidder is reportedly scrambling up to the block.
    • TI said it favored a bid from infrastructure fund F2i and tower company Raiway, which Reuters says valued the unit around €250M.
    • The board gave CEO Amos Genish the mandate to finalize the deal and consider other binding offers; meanwhile, U.S. fund I Squared Capital has reportedly come forward with a (so far) nonbinding expression of interest that values Persidera at €290M.
    • TI has a 70% stake in Persidera that it considers a nonstrategic asset.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • JWN

    Nordstrom family looking to seal go-private deal

    • CNBC reports that the Nordstrom (JWN +6%) family is looking to lock down a go-private deal before the company reports earnings on March 1.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 10 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake's huge Thursday rally not justified, analyst says

    • Chesapeake Energy (CHK -2%) gives back a chunk of yesterday's huge rally, which Bernstein analyst Bob Brackett says caught him by surprise since he sees little in the company's earnings report to justify the ~20% jump.
    • Noting the relatively high short interest in CHK, Brackett says he "not rule out a short squeeze."
    • While CHK expects to close another $500M in asset sales during H1 2018, Brackett sees such transactions which take away EBITDA as "a means of disinvestment, not value creation."
    • The firm rates CHK at Market Perform.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 87 Comments
  • KMPH

    FDA approves KemPharm's Apadaz

    • The FDA approves KemPharm’s (NASDAQ:KMPH) Apadaz, an opioid painkiller for short-term acute pain management.
    • KemPharm says the DEA plans to schedule Apadaz as a C-II product, which is considered to have high abuse potential and has stricter regulations.
    • Previously: KemPharm halted, news on FDA decision on Apadaz pending (Feb. 23)
    • Update: KemPharm shares will resume trading at 2:30 PM.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 9 Comments
  • TUSK

    Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm (2/23/2018)

    • Gainers: TUSK +13%. ASIX +11%. AROC +8%. SND +7%. APLP +7%.
    • Losers: INT -17%. KGJI -10%. SMLP -8%. VNTR -8%. GEOS -8%.

  • C

    Citi giving back $335M to its credit card users

    • Citigroup (C +0.2%) announces the refund after an internal review flagged issues in the methodology used to reduce interest rates on users with high rates due to prior missed payments.
    • The bank notes 90% of clients did receive the lower rate.
    • A Citi spokeswoman said, “We informed our regulators, revised our methodology going forward and conducted a comprehensive review of our process.”
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 3 Comments
  • NIHD

    NII Holdings jumps alongside Brazil regulator's spectrum cap moves

    • NII Holdings (NASDAQ:NIHD), parent of Nextel Brazil, is up 41.7% as Brazil's National Telecommunications Agency (Anatel) reportedly looks at lifting spectrum caps on mobile operators, to 40% in some cases.
    • Operators in lower-frequency bands up to 1 GHz are limited to 29%, and would rise to 35% and possibly 40% depending on Anatel's decision. For 1 GHz-3 GHz, currently limited to 21%, it could rise to 30% automatically and 40% conditionally.
    • And that might spur consolidation toward three companies.
    • A report last week has AT&T (NYSE:T) eyeing a spectrum buy later this year in order to enter Brazil's market.
    • Other Brazil market players: VIV +2.7%, AMX flat, TSU +1.5%.
    • In recent weeks a decision by Anatel to releaase performance bonds securing Nextel Brazil's geographic coverage obligations meant the company would recover 156M reais (about $47M) of cash collateral.
    • Source (Brazilian Portuguese)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM | 7 Comments
  • OKTA

    Analyst sees 20% upside to Okta on identity market potential

    • Deutsche Bank initiates Okta (NASDAQ:OKTA) with a Buy rating and $43 price target, a 20% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • Firm bullish on Okta despite the expense because the company facilitates the adoption of cloud and SaaS-based apps with its identity platform, which is a market benefitting from increased awareness with IT buyers.
    • Deutsche says Okta differentiates with advanced integration capabilities with SaaS apps from multiple platforms operating as if on one platform. 
    • Firm estimates that Okta has a 5% share of the identity market but +20% of the growth. 
    • Source: Briefing.com. 
    • Okta shares are up 1.8% to $36.46 with a 52-week range of $21.52 to $37.24.       
    • Previously: Okta +2% on preliminary Q4, FY guidance (Feb. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM | 6 Comments
  • KMPH

    KemPharm halted, news on FDA decision on Apadaz pending

    • Nasdaq has suspended trading in KemPharm (KMPH -5%) pending the release of news, assuredly regarding its New Drug Application seeking approval for pain med Apadaz (benzhydrocodone and acetaminophen). The FDA's action date is today.
    • Previously: KemPharm completes dispute resolution process with FDA over Apadaz application; shares up 2% (Sept. 12, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 19 Comments

    Midday Gainers / Losers (2/23/2018)

    • Gainers: ADMP +39%. VICR +38%. FNGN +27%. UEIC +23%. TTD +20%. EMMS +19%. WIN +17%. BUFF +17%. ITGR +14%. MOMO +14%.
    • Losers: SSC-OLD -30%. DAIO -23%. WK -20%. MRIN -18%. INT -16%. OLED -16%. LPNT -16%. ACIA -15%. KBR -14%. MDCA -13%.

  • SLB

    Schlumberger, Subsea 7 seek to start oil services joint venture

    • Schlumberger (SLB +2.1%) and Subsea 7 (OTCPK:SUBCY +7.3%) say they have launched exclusive talks to form a 50-50 joint venture to deliver subsea installations and services for oilfields, sending Subsea shares higher on hopes the talks could be the first step toward a full takeover.
    • The two companies have collaborated since 2015 for some of their work in designing, building and laying oil and gas production installations on the seabed.
    • “We view the deal as highly positive for Subsea 7,” says Arctic Securities analyst Tord Aasen Augestad, adding that the joint venture “improves their competitive position and creates a unique platform to capture market share in a recovering subsea market.”
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • MSFT

    Microsoft and Xiaomi will collaborate on cloud, AI, and hardware

    • Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) and Xiaomi (XI) announce a Strategic Framework Memorandum of Understanding to collaborate on cloud computing, AI, and hardware.
    • Xiaomi will use Microsoft Azure for cloud services.
    • Microsoft will co-market Xiaomi’s Windows laptops.
    • The two will discuss potential AI-powered speakers using Microsoft’s Cortana voice assistant. 
    • What Xiaomi could gain: A stronger foothold in Western markets.
    • What Microsoft could gain: Presence in the mobile market after the abandonment of Windows Mobile and perhaps a wider acceptance of its Cortana voice assistant. 
    • Microsoft shares are up 1.8% to $93.36.       
    • Previously: Intel collaborates with PC makers for 5G connection (Feb. 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 5 Comments
  • ERF

    Enerplus +6% after strong Q4, driven by Bakken production

    • Enerplus (ERF +6.2%) enjoys strong gains after reporting better than expected Q4 earnings, helped by higher prices for production from its North Dakota Bakken oil wells and lower costs.
    • ERF says the average selling price for crude oil rose 22% to C$65.91/bbl in Q4 and natural gas prices rose 4.8%.
    • ERF says Q4 production totaled 88.6K boe/day, beating company guidance of 86K-88K boe/day, primarily driven by its oil and gas reserves in the Bakken and the Marcellus gas basin in the Appalachian region, and that its recently completed well in the DJ Basin produced nearly 47K barrels of oil in 156 days; the company plans to drill up to three wells in the DJ region in 2018.
    • ERF reaffirms its 2018 capex forecast of C$535M-C$585M, with plans to spend 75% to develop its North Dakota assets.
    • "Strong results over the past several quarters have been driven by Enerplus’ solid Bakken execution which we expect to continue,” says AltaCorp Capital analyst Patrick O‘Rourke.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • RGR

    Gun names lower as Florida moves to restrict ownership

    • Among gun reforms being proposed by Florida Governor Rick Scott would be requiring anyone purchasing firearms to be over the age of 21.
    • He would also step up efforts to keep anyone with mental issues from possessing a gun.
    • Sturm Ruger (RGR -3.4%), American Outdoor (AOBC -3.4%), Vista Outdoor (VSTO -0.8%)
    • See also: MetLife, Chubb attempt to get in front of gun issue (Feb. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 28 Comments
  • UEIC

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm (2/23/2018)

    • Gainers: UEIC +20%. BUFF +17%. WATT +10%. FRPT +8%.
    • Losers: SUMR -7%. BRFS -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • TWI

    Titan International beats estimates in Q4

    • Titan International (TWI +11.9%) reports revenue growth of 22% in Q4, due to growth experienced in all segments and regions.
    • Volume up 16%, with higher volume across all segments.
    • Segment revenue: Agricultural: $165.9M (+14.2%); Earthmoving/construction: $165.86M (+35.2%); Consumer: $44.27M (+12.2%).
    • Comparable gross margin rate grew 164 bps to 12%.
    • SG&A expense rate improved 280 bps to 9.3%, as a result of management's continuing efforts to reduce costs.
    • Adjusted EBITDA expanded 211% to $22.1M for the period.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • ACIA

    Acacia -15.7% as analysts reset views after revenue miss

    • As with other optical-equipment stocks this earnings season, Acacia Communications (NASDAQ:ACIA) is on the slide after a revenue miss and light guidance, down 15.7%.
    • MKM Partners has downgraded shares to Neutral, pointing to a business model that calls for big opex increases even as revenues are mostly stagnant. Based on company guidance (for Q1 revenue of $67M-$74M vs. consensus for $93.2M), he's changed his revenue forecast from a gain of 18% to a 5% decline instead. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Needham also downgraded to Hold. Meanwhile Morgan Stanley lowered its price target to $37, implying just 4.8% upside from current pricing.
    • Cowen noted "another disappointing quarter but updated its price target by raising to $45 from $41.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • SMLP

    Summit Midstream -7% after 2018 EBITDA guidance miss

    • Summit Midstream Partners (SMLP -7%) plunges as much as 7.7% to its lowest level since last April after reporting a Q4 GAAP loss of $0.32/share vs. earnings of $0.16 a year ago as well as disappointing 2018 guidance.
    • SMLP’s FY 2018 EBITDA guidance of $285M-$300M includes ~$8M in incremental operating expenses relative to 2017 and misses the consensus forecast of $336M. according to Bloomberg data.
    • The company’s Q4 EBITDA of $73M also missed the $76M analyst consensus estimate.
    • SMLP anticipates minimal EBITDA contribution from northern Delaware and DJ Basin natural gas gathering and processing projects in 2018 due to the expected timing of project commissioning; planned capex for the year is $175M-$225M.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • ADMP

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am (2/23/2018)

    • Gainers: ADMP +24%. ITGR +16%. MYOS +14%. AHPI +9%. TVTY +8%.
    • Losers: ANIK -14%. ADMS -13%. LPNT -13%. HTBX -11%. INSM -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • ZAYO

    Zayo to sell local exchange carrier for $42M

    • Zayo (NYSE:ZAYO) will sell Scott-Rice Telephone Co. to New Ulm telecom for $42M.
    • Zayo acquired the Minnesota incumbent local exchange carrier in its March 2017 purchase of Electric Lightwave. 
    • Deal expected to close in the June quarter. 
    • Zayo shares are up 0.3% to $35.84. 
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • TST

    NY Post: Tronc considering TheStreet acquisition; TST +10.7%

    • Shares of TheStreet.com (NASDAQ:TST) pop 10.7% after the NY Post speculates the company is again an acquisition target of tronc (TRNC).
    • Tronc circled TheStreet in the past but operations were struggling with a threatened Nasdaq delisting in 2016. 
    • TheStreet had $55M of preferred stock from Technology Crossover Partners on its books but those holdings were converted to about $20M in cash and 6M shares of common stock in November. 
    • Earlier this month, Tronc paid $66M for a 60% stake in consumer product review site BestReviews. 
    • Tronc shares are down 0.56%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • PLNT

    Planet Fitness pops after earnings shine

    • Planet Fitness (NYSE:PLNT) rips a 13% gain after edging past consensus estimates with its Q4 report.
    • Comparable sales increased 11% during the crucial post-holiday period.
    • During the earnings call, CFO Dorvin Lively said the company still sees "significant favorability" on the real estate site availability front, mentioning the Toys "R" Us development.
    • Shares of Planet Fitness hit a new all-time week high of $37.33 within the last hour.
    • Planet Fitness earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 2 Comments
  • KBR

    KBR -9% after Q4 earnings miss, 21% revenue drop

    • KBR (KBR -9.4%) plunges after missing Q4 earnings expectations and reporting a 21% Y/Y revenue decline.
    • KBR says Q4 engineering and construction revenue fell 45% Y/Y to $293M, primarily due to completion or near completion of several projects across the segment; for the full year, E&C's revenue fell 31% to $1.6B, and overall company revenues slipped to $4.2B from $4.3B in 2016.
    • Operating cash flow for FY 2017 was $193M vs. $61M in 2016, helped by significantly improved overall profitability during the year; backlog rose by $300M to $10.6B.
    • KBR issues upside guidance for FY 2018, seeing EPS of $1.35-$1.45 vs. $1.36 analyst consensus estimate.
    • KBR also says it secured a ~$2B financing commitment to complete a recapitalization plan to finance its SGT acquisition, among other reasons.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 2 Comments
  • YY

    YY +3.1% after start at Buy by New Street

    • YY ADRs are up 3.1% after a New Street launch at Buy.
    • The firm set its price target at $180, implying 34.6% upside from today's higher price.
    • As with its initiation of Momo, New Street is joining a parade of Buy signals on Momo.
    • Earlier in the week, Citi started both companies at Buy as well, spurring similar moves in the stocks.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARII

    More on American Railcar Industries' Q4

    • American Railcar Industries (ARII +1.2%) reports Manufacturing revenues fell 30% to $80.3M in Q4, driven by the impact of fewer railcar shipments for direct sale for both hopper and tank railcars with a higher mix of hopper railcars sold, a higher percentage of railcar shipments going to the Company's lease fleet, and more competitive pricing during the quarter.
    • Railcar leasing revenues rose 2% to $34.1M.
    • Railcar services revenues dropped 6% to $18M, primarily due to performing more intercompany work related to the FRA's Revised Directive.
    • Operating margin rate dropped 940 bps to 12.9%, due to lower earnings from operations in the Company's manufacturing segment.
    • Adjusted EBITDA down 34.8% to $33.79M.
    • The Company did not repurchase any shares of its common stock in FY2017 under its stock repurchase program.
    • Backlog as of December 31, was 1,940 railcars with an estimated market value of $172.6M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 2 Comments
  • H

    Hyatt Hotels raises capital returns guidance

    • Hyatt Hotels (H) announces that it expects to return a minimum of $500M to shareholders in capital this year to top the prior outlook for $300M in capital returns.
    • The disclosure came alongside the company's announcement that it was unloading three hotels to Host Hotels & Resorts.
    • Previously: Hyatt unloads three properties to Host Hotels & Resorts for $1B (Feb. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • LC

    LendingClub downgraded at Guggenheim as competition intensifies, shares down 8% today

    • LendingClub (LC -7.5%) is cut to neutral from a buy at Guggenheim as competiton in the personal lending business intensifies according to analyst Jeff Cantwell.
    • Cantwell, sees lower growth, and mentioned serious competitive pressure from big banks noting Goldman Sachs' recent investor presentation outlining focus on personal loans.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 32 Comments

  • GIS

    General Mills lower after monster deal

    • General Mills (NYSE:GIS) is down 3.88% in early trading after the blockbuster deal for Blue Buffalo Pet Products as investors worry that the company may have taken quite a big bite with the acquisition.
    • Jefferies is out with a note on the deal. On the positive side analyst Akshay Jagdale doesn't think a competing bid is likely, but he warns of execution risk due to General Mills' track record in new product area.
    • S&P Global Ratings wasted no time in downgrading General Mills to BBB from BBB+ due to the extra leverage.
    • Susquehanna analyst Pablo Zuanic has a more positive assessment, saying the deal makes sense. "The move is not unexpected, as slow growth CPG companies seek to enter the faster growth segment of natural and premium pet food. For example, Smucker diversified into Big Heart, and WhiteWave Foods, prior to being acquired by Danone, put forward the highest bid for Merrick’s (bought by Nestle)," he observes.
    • Previously: General Mills to buy Blue Buffalo for $8B (Feb. 23)

    Kazia Therapeutics' GDC-0084 an Orphan Drug in U.S. for brain cancer; shares up 12% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Kazia Therapeutics (NASDAQ:KZIA) is up 12% premarket on light volume in response to the news that the FDA has designated GDC-0084 an Orphan Drug for the treatment glioblastoma multiforme, the most common and aggressive form of brain tumor.
    • Among the benefits of Orphan Drug status in the U.S. is a seven-year period of market exclusivity for the indication, if approved.
    • Phase 2-stage GDC-0084 is a small molecule inhibitor of the PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathway that can penetrate the blood-brain barrier. Kazia (formerly Novogen) licensed it from Roche's Genentech in October 2016.

  • KDMN

    Kadmon's KD025 shows positive effect in mid-stage GvHD study; shares up 8% premarket

    • Updated results from a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating Kadmon Holdings' (NYSE:KDMN) KD025 in adult patients with chronic graft-vs-host disease (GvHD) showed a treatment benefit. The data are being presented today at the BMT Tandem Meetings in Salt Lake City, UT.
    • Data from Cohort 2 (n=16) showed an overall response rate (ORR) of 69% (n=11/16) as of the data cutoff of January 3. The ORR in Cohort 1 remained 65% (n=11/17). 70% (n=23/33) of patients across both cohorts responded within eight weeks.
    • Responses were observed across all affected organs. In responders with at least four organs involved, 46% (n=6/13) showed responses in at least four organs.
    • 64% of patients were able to reduce steroid use with four able to totally discontinue steroid therapy. 83% were able to reduce the dose of tacrolimus (Astellas' PROGRAF).
    • On the safety front, KD025 was well-tolerated with no drug-related serious events observed.
    • An expansion cohort of 40 patients will now be enrolled.
    • Small molecule KD025 inhibits an pro-inflammatory enzyme called rho-associated coiled-coil kinase 2 (ROCK2). Inhibiting the enzyme down-regulates the ability of the immune system's T cells to secrete IL-21 and IL-17, thereby dampening the immune response.
    • Shares are up 8% premarket on light volume.
    • Previously: Investors underwhelmed with mid-stage data on Kadmon's KD025 in IPF; shares down 13% (Feb. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:07 AM | 4 Comments
